item.title: Jessica add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious - the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science." -- Albert Einstein
